preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean and dry mixing container, add 200 g of Chromium(III) oxide (Cr2O3). 
 2. Gradually add 300 g of Sodium sulfate (Na2SO4) while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 
 3. Slowly incorporate 100 g of Sulfur (S) into the mixture, maintaining constant stirring. 
 4. Add 50 g of Sodium carbonate (Na2CO3) to the mixture and stir thoroughly until a homogenous blend is achieved. 
 5. Finally, add 150 mL of distilled water to the dry mixture and continue stirring until a thick paste forms.
